ygData.subject: Did You Know?
ygData.msgSnippet: At first the small group of Decepticons didn t know quite what Maxima was talking about...they d all thought they were heading to this base she d talked about

At first the small group of Decepticons didn't know quite what Maxima was 
talking about...they'd all thought they were heading to this base she'd 
talked about before. For a bit of R&R.
But now it looked like she didn't have that in mind anymore.

So, not quite knowing what to do...they looked to their commander for any 
ideas on the situation.
And by then, D.R. was already searching her internal thought banks.
Maxima had mentioned "action", which, to her suggested battle. Or something 
along those lines.
But they weren't equip properly for combat, and their weapons were mainly 
used to help in their research somehow.
Not fight.

D.R. put on the breaks and skidded to a stop.
Well, this Maxima was the one who'd come to rescue them...so the least they 
could do was go with her and see if they could help her in any way.
So, in a wide turn, she followed after the animal/jet plane. Followed by her 
own little group.

Sand Storm revved his engine in confusion as he drove up alongside Blue 
Flame. " What the slag are we doing? We're not battle bots!" he complained 
in a high whine.
Although Blue Flame only kept driving. " Don't you know ANYTHING about 
Diesel Runner? She's just listening to her inner programming."

The little dune buggy didn't get it. " Well, that 'inner programming's going 
to get us killed."
"No it won't, Sand Storm. D.R. knows what she's doing." the big semi 
answered confidently.

"What do you mean?"

"Well...she's a battle bot and knows all about combat and things like that. 
So it's not like she's going to lead us blindly into danger or anything." 
Blue Flame explained.

This got a shock from Sand Storm, "But I thought she was a research bot like 
the rest of us. I didn't know she knew how to fight." he confessed.

"Actually, D.R.s battle training goes all the way back to the end of the 
Great War between the Autobots and the Decepticons."

Sand Storm just drove along, listening to Blue Flame's history lesson. So 
the huge semi-truck went on.
" Back in those days it's rumored that Galvatron had a few followers on 
Cybertron. Though they laid low so that the Autobots wouldn't be any the 
wiser. Yet they wanted to help Galvatron win the war, so they constructed a 
few new transformers for his cause.
Sad thing is, by the time the transformers rolled off the assembly line, the 
Autobot's had already won the war and Galvatron was nowhere to be found. And 
the new Golden Age of cybertron had returned."
He paused for a moment.
" Diesel Runner was one of those transformers. A new breed that would have 
put Cyclonus and those Sweeps of Galvatron's to shame.
But they never got the chance.
Instead, as the eons passed by and the relationships between the Autobots 
and Decepticons evened out, old army bots like D.R. were restationed to easy 
jobs. Like research. Where they'd be out of trouble.
Truth is, battle's in her programming. And there's no denying it.
It's just a shame Galvatron wasn't around long enough to recruit those few 
bots...because they could have spelled his victory instead of defeat."

"Maybe then we wouldn't be treated like slag NOW by the Autobots and their 
prissy offspring, if we'd won the war instead." Sand Storm commented, with a 
bit more venom in his voice then he thought possible.
But, then again, he'd never liked the Maximals, and always steered clear of 
the Autobots too.
Even the Predacons treated them with as little or no respect as those other 
two factions.
What had Cybertron come to?

Still, it was kind of neat to know now that they were being led by one of 
the transformers who'd been construction especially to help Galvatron's 
cause. Although she'd never gotten the chance.
Kind of made the thought of battle seem not so bad after all.
